newsitem.title: THAILAND: Argentine President Menem arrives in Thailand.
newsitem.headline: Argentine President Menem arrives in Thailand.

text.p: Argentine President Carlos Saul Menem arrived in Thailand on Tuesday for a three-day visit to seek stronger trade and bilateral ties, Thai officials said.
Menem, who flew in from Vietnam, is the second Argentinian leader to visit Thailand since 1961.
He will meet Thai Prime Minister Chavalit Yongchaiyudh and receive an audience from King Bhumibol Adulyadej.
Agentina is Thailand's biggest trade partner among Latin American nations and bilateral trade amounted to about 5.0 billion baht ($200 million) last year.
Thailand imports mainly leather products, steel and animal feed ingredients and exports textiles, rubber and canned tuna to Agentina.
